sentence.Network_en: He applies the Marxist world view dogmatically to all social phenomena.
sentence.Network_cn: 他将马克思主义的世界观教条地应用到所有的社会现象中去。

sentence.Network_en: Leonardo made quite a point of distrusting the knowledge that scholars professed so dogmatically.
sentence.Network_cn: 雷钠德郑重宣布他不相信经院派学者奉为金科玉律的知识.

sentence.Network_en: He is a dogmatically opinionated critic of modern art.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是一个独断而又固执己见的现代艺术评论家.

entry.def: If you say that someone is dogmatic, you are critical of them because they are convinced that they are right, and refuse to consider that other opinions might also be justified.

example.ex: Many writers at this time held rigidly dogmatic views...
example.tran: 这时期有很多作家固执己见。

example.ex: The regime is dogmatic, and no one dares to express personal opinions.
example.tran: 该政权很专制，没有人敢表达个人意见。

sentences.sentence: "he is a dogmatically opinionated critic of Modern Art"

auth_sentence.content: To dogmatically state that either theory is fact is religious in nature.
